critique: This executive order establishes a White House Homeland Security Partnership Council to foster local partnerships between the Federal Government and various organizations to address homeland security challenges. It aims to improve collaboration and resource utilization in areas such as disaster response and terrorism prevention. The order emphasizes the importance of partnerships and an all-of-Nation effort. It establishes a Council and a Steering Committee to guide the partnerships. The order does not seem to lean heavily on any particular ideology. It promotes collaboration between federal and local entities, which suggests a cooperative balance. It also mentions appropriate protections for privacy and civil liberties. It doesn't seem to expand executive power significantly, as it focuses on partnerships and collaboration. It doesn't directly address immigration, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
